column2: ILLINOIS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 2. A second DUI conviction within 20 years results in a minimum:
3. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
4. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.
column8: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
6. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 7. Hitchhiking is:
8. This road sign means:
column8: This parking is reserved for persons with disabilities.

column2: 9. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
10. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 11. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on highways with four lanes is:
12. Warning signs normally are:
13. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 14. A yellow sign with a black “X” and the letters “RR” means:
column8: this lane signal is going to change to red.

column2: 15. You may pass on the right when you have enough room on a two-lane roadway, and when the vehicle you are passing is making a left turn.
16. This sign indicates:
column4: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column6: that you must not drive past this sign.
column8: the entrance to a dead-end street.

column2: 17. A flashing red light:
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 18. This sign warns you of:
19. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 20. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 21. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 22. A driver must yield the right of way even after the light turns green when there are vehicles in the intersection.
23. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 24. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: share the lane with another vehicle.
column6: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 25. Drivers whose licenses have been revoked as a result of DUI must meet several requirements, including undergoing an evaluation for alcohol and drug problems and paying a reinstatement fee, to regain their licenses.
26. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.

column2: 27. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
28. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
29. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

32. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 33. In Illinois, the use of handheld cellphones while driving is:
column6: allowed for drivers ages 21 and older.
column8: allowed for drivers ages 19 or older.
